Find shelter: The first thing I would do if I woke up on a deserted island is find shelter. I would look for a natural cave or overhang to protect myself from the elements. If I can't find a natural shelter, I would use my survival skills to create a makeshift shelter using materials found on the island, such as palm fronds, branches, and vines. Confidence score: 0.8

Find a source of fresh water: Finding a source of fresh water is crucial for survival. I would search for a stream, river, or pond, or I would collect rainwater using a tarp or a large leaf. I would also make sure to purify the water before drinking it to avoid getting sick. Confidence score: 0.9

Start a fire: Fire is essential for survival, as it provides warmth, light, and a way to cook food. I would gather dry wood and other flammable materials and use my survival skills to start a fire. I would also make sure to keep the fire contained and controlled to avoid burning myself or the island. Confidence score: 0.9

Find food: I would search for edible plants, fruits, and berries on the island. I would also try to catch fish or other sea creatures using a makeshift fishing net or by hand. If I have the necessary tools, I would also try to hunt for land animals. Confidence score: 0.8

Signal for help: Once I have basic necessities, I would create a signal fire or use a mirror to signal for help. I would also use any available materials to create a makeshift raft or signaling device to attract attention from passing boats or planes. Confidence score: 0.9
